summary: Build a cute multi-page birthday/proposal website for Saniya with interactive yes/no questions that progressively discourage 'No', plus celebration and kiss effects and a final birthday wish flow.

existing_features.title: Create a 4-page client-side routed React experience that follows the sequence Page 1 → Page 2 → Page 3 → Page 4, with each route rendering its page correctly on direct navigation/refresh.
Implement Page 1 as a cute birthday-themed landing page that includes Saniya’s name and the proposal question “Will you marry me?” with two buttons: “Yes” and “No”.

On Page 1, implement a progressive “No” interaction: each time the user clicks “No”, the “No” label (or a nearby prompt) changes to a different escalating message (e.g., “Really?”, “Are you sure?”, etc.) and continues repeating/cycling until the user clicks “Yes”.
When the user clicks “Yes” on Page 1, play a celebration effect (confetti and/or hearts) and then automatically navigate to Page 2 after a short delay.
Implement Page 2 with the question text: “In your point of view, your boyfriend is really hot and cute and sexy.” Provide two options: “Yes” and “Obviously”.
On Page 2, when the user selects either option (“Yes” or “Obviously”), play a kiss effect animation and then automatically navigate to Page 3 after a short delay.
Implement Page 3 as a birthday wishes page that shows a full birthday message and ends with the exact last line: “I love you so much, my ardhangani!”.
After Page 3 is shown, automatically navigate to Page 4 after a short delay (no user action required).
Implement Page 4 as an emotional final page that asks: “Do you really like this??” and displays: “Never leave me” followed by an emotional emoji (use English user-facing text).
Apply a cohesive, cute romantic birthday visual theme across all pages using a baby pink & white color palette (no blue/purple as primary), with consistent typography, spacing, and button styles.
Add generated static images to frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI (do not serve images from the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create cute front page for Saniya's birthday with proposal question 'Will you marry me?' and Yes/No options where clicking No repeatedly changes the prompt until she clicks Yes
After first Yes, trigger a celebration effect and navigate to a second page with question: "In your point of view your boyfriend is really hot and cute and sexy" with options Yes and Obviously
After second question confirmation, trigger a kiss effect and navigate to a third page showing birthday wishes and ending with the line: "i lobe you so much my ardhangani !"
Add a fourth page asking 'do you really like this ??' and displaying 'never leave me' with an emotional emoji
Create a cute, birthday-themed landing page (Page 1) for Saniya that displays her name and asks the question: "Will you marry me?" with two buttons: "Yes" and "No".

On Page 1, implement a progressive "No" interaction: each time the user clicks "No", update the button label or nearby prompt text to a different message (e.g., "Really?", "Are you sure?", etc.) and continue cycling/escalating until the user clicks "Yes".
When the user clicks "Yes" on Page 1, play a celebration effect (confetti and/or hearts) and then automatically navigate to Page 2.
Implement Page 2 with the question text: "In your point of view your boyfriend is really hot and cute and sexy" and provide two options: "Yes" and "Obviously".
On Page 2, when the user selects either option ("Yes" or "Obviously"), play a "kiss effect" animation and then automatically navigate to Page 3.
Implement Page 3 as a birthday wishes page that shows a full birthday message and ends with the exact last line: "I love you so much, my ardhangani!"
Implement Page 4 that asks: "Do you really like this??" and also displays the message: "Never leave me" with an emotional emoji.

Add client-side routing and a simple flow state so the experience works as a 4-page sequence (Page 1 → Page 2 → Page 3 → Page 4), including direct navigation behavior on refresh (each route renders its page).
Apply a cohesive, cute romantic birthday visual theme across all pages (consistent colors, typography, spacing, and components) without using a blue/purple primary palette.
Add required generated static images into the frontend and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve generated images from the backend).

architecturalNotes: Design/theme preference confirmed: use a baby pink and white color combination across the website.
Confirmed name spelling is exactly: Saniya.
Confirmed copy can be slightly polished/smoothed (keep meaning/cute tone) rather than keeping the exact original wording.
Theme confirmed: baby pink + white across the website (no additional primary palettes).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Cute baby-pink heart confetti seamless background (bg-hearts-seamless.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Kawaii birthday cake illustration with pastel pink accents (cake-kawaii.dim_512x512.png)
- Cute kissing/love icon illustration in baby-pink style (kiss-icon.dim_512x512.png)
- Small heart sparkle sticker set (hearts-stickers.dim_512x512.png)

Kawaii birthday cake illustration with pastel pink accents

projectName: Birthday proposal multi-page website for Saniya with playful Yes/No interactions and celebration/kiss effects
